logicalComponents
Class Port

java.lang.Object
  logicalComponents.Port

public class Port
extends java.lang.Object

Port class This class handles opening and closing the port, as well as reading and sending data. Any program that wishes to use this program with event-driven capabilities must implement the SerialPortEventListener interface described in the javax.comm package.

Constructor Summary
Port()
          Creates a Port object that is ready for reading and writing via the serial port.
 
Method Summary
 void addEventListener(SerialPortEventListener listener)
          Adds the given SerialPortEventListener to this Port.
 void close()
          Closes the serial port.
 int[] read()
          Reads in all data in the input buffer of the serial port.
 void removeEventListener()
          Removes the SerialPortEventListener from this Port.
 byte[] write(byte[] value)
          Writes the array of bytes to the serial port.
 int write(int value)
          Writes the value to the serial port.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Port

public Port()
Creates a Port object that is ready for reading and writing via the serial port. In order to receive events, the SerialPortEventListener interface must be implemented and registered to this class.

Method Detail

write

public int write(int value)
Writes the value to the serial port. Is untested for values greater than 255.

Parameters:
value - the value to be written to the serial port
Returns:
the value to be written to the serial port, or -1 if the send failed

write

public byte[] write(byte[] value)
Writes the array of bytes to the serial port.

Parameters:
value - the values to be written to the serial port
Returns:
the values, or null if the send failed

read

public int[] read()
Reads in all data in the input buffer of the serial port.

Returns:
an array with each item being a value in the buffer, or an empty array if the read fails

addEventListener

public void addEventListener(SerialPortEventListener listener)
Adds the given SerialPortEventListener to this Port. Only one listener is allowed at a time, so if there is already a listener assigned, then nothing happens.

Parameters:
listener - the javax.comm.SerialPortEventListener which is to be added to this Port

removeEventListener

public void removeEventListener()
Removes the SerialPortEventListener from this Port.

close

public void close()
Closes the serial port.
